intro: Tapeinostemon zamoranus, commonly known as the Zamora's spurge, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure typical of the spurge family. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
